content:
What a fantastic idea! Serving the Spring Fling cocktail in a coupe glass with a sprig of rosemary as a garnish is a brilliant move. The piney flavor of the rosemary will indeed complement the herbal notes in the gin, and the citrusy flavor of the lime juice will cut through the richness of the honey syrup perfectly.

The coupe glass is a great choice, as it will showcase the beautiful color and clarity of the cocktail. The rosemary sprig garnish will add a fragrant, herbaceous aroma to the drink, which will enhance the overall flavor experience.

Here are a few additional tips to take your Spring Fling cocktail to the next level:

1. **Use a high-quality gin**: Choose a gin that has a nice balance of herbal and citrus flavors to complement the rosemary and lime juice.
2. **Don't over-muddle the rosemary**: When muddling the rosemary, be gentle to avoid bruising the leaves and releasing bitter flavors. A light press with the muddler should be enough to release the oils and flavors.
3. **Adjust the amount of honey syrup**: Depending on your personal taste, you may want to adjust the amount of honey syrup to balance the sweetness and acidity of the cocktail.
4. **Garnish with a lime wheel**: In addition to the rosemary sprig, consider garnishing the cocktail with a lime wheel to add a pop of color and a touch of citrus flavor.

Overall, your Spring Fling cocktail is shaping up to be a refreshing and flavorful drink that will pair perfectly with your spring-inspired menu. I'm sure your dinner party will be a huge success!
